intro: Weinmannia fagaroides, commonly known as the silverleaf weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage due to dense pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and shaded landscapes.
